translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of Fruits
the god of gods, the bull of men,

original: Rathiyaṁ paṭipajjantaṁ,🔽kosambaṁ adadiṁ tadā.🔽Ekatiṁse ito kappe,
analyzed: rathiyam paṭipajjanta  kosambam adadim tadā  ekatise itas kappe
translated: walking along the road,🔽I gave him a kosambha fruit.🔽Thirty-one aeons ago,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving fruit.
My defilements have been burned up,
How welcome it was for me,
I have done what the Awakened One said.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kosambaphaliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā kosambaphaliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the venerable Kosambaphaliyathera recited these verses.
The Story of Kosambaphaliyathera is the third one.
